bibl.title: Letter from Foster Kennedy to Philip Showalter Hench, August 12, 1946

div1.p: Kennedy invites Hench to come see him in New York.

div1.head: Letter from Foster Kennedy to Philip Showalter Hench, August 12, 1946
div1.opener:
TEL. PLAZA 3-7161
FOSTER KENNEDY, M. D.
410 EAST 57TH STREET
NEW YORK 22, N. Y.
August 12, 1946
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
What a comedy of errors! I
am so sorry that we did not meet when we were just
across the room from each other from time to time.

Please come and see me when
you are next in New York.

I had a similar experience
with another friend, an actor whom I have known
since I was 20, brought over fr. London to Hollywood because
he is perfectly cast for President Roosevelt. We
each frantically tried to find the other from New
York to San Francisco and Hollywood. Today I had
a letter from him from London to tell me that he
had passed through the United States like a dose
of salts, which explained my failure to catch him.

How interesting that you
should have seen Houston Lazear and how odd that
he should know so little about his famous father.
